intro: Graptopetalum pentandrum subsp. superbum, commonly known as the Ghost Plant, is a succulent native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the spring. It is a low-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
